q: " for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise , senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," David Wise said. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as chief executive by co-founder Larry Page , 37.

reference to interest rates being charged on loans provided by the U.S. and Canadian governments was "inappropriate." "I regret the remark," Sergio Marchionne said in a statement posted on Chrysler's website. As the only parties willing to underwrite the risk associated with Chrysler's recovery plan, the two governments levied interest rates that, although appropriate at the time, are above current market conditions. Chrysler is paying "shyster rates" to government lenders of last resort because banks reduced credit during the recession in 2008 and 2009, Sergio Marchionne said.
